alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 04 at 2:19PM EDT until August 04 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Essex County in northern New York... Southwestern Addison County in central Vermont... Northwestern Rutland County in southern Vermont... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 218 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over North Hudson, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Moriah, Crown Point, Schroon Lake, Port Henry, Addison, Shoreham, D A R State Park, Crown Point Center, Bridport, Orwell, Benson, Weybridge, North Hudson, Owls Head Bay, Benson Bay, Black Point, Plumies Point, Gilligans Bay, Giards Bay, and Fivemile Point. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Champlain, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
